field.label: Prefer older IPsec SAs
field.help: By default, if several SAs match, the newest one is preferred if it's at least 30 seconds old. Select this option to always prefer old SAs over new ones.

field.label: Disable legacy auto-added VPN rules.
field.help: This option only applies to legacy tunnel configurations, connections do require manual firewall rules being setup.

field.label: Passthrough networks
field.help: This exempts traffic for one or more subnets from getting processed by the IPsec stack in the kernel. When sending all traffic to the remote location, you probably want to add your lan network(s) here.

field.label: Authentication (Xauth)
field.help: Select authentication methods to use, leave empty if no challenge response authentication is needed.

field.label: Enforce local group (Xauth)
field.help: Restrict access to users in the selected local group. Please be aware that other authentication backends will refuse to authenticate when using this option.

field.label: Servers
field.help: RADIUS servers to configure

field.label: Accounting
field.help: Enable RADIUS accounting

field.label: Pam_service
field.help: PAM service to use for authentication.

field.label: Session
field.help: Open/close a PAM session for each active IKE_SA

field.label: Trim_email
field.help: If an email address is received as an XAuth username, trim it to just the username part

field.label: Maximum IKEv1 phase 2 exchanges
field.help: Maximum number of IKEv1 phase 2 exchanges per IKE_SA to keep state about and track concurrently. When using multiple phase 2 definitions a higher value than the default (3) would be advisable to prevent re-keying issues

field.label: Ignore acquire ts
field.help: If this is disabled the traffic selectors from the kernel’s acquire events, which are derived from the triggering packet, are prepended to the traffic selectors from the configuration for IKEv2 connection. By enabling this, such specific traffic selectors will be ignored and only the ones in the config will be sent. This always happens for IKEv1 connections as the protocol only supports one set of traffic selectors per CHILD SA

field.label: Threads
field.help: Number of worker threads in Several of these are reserved for long running tasks in internal modules and plugins. Therefore, make sure you don’t set this value too low.

field.label: IKESA table size
field.help: Size of the IKE SA hash table

field.label: IKESA table segments
field.help: Number of exclusively locked segments in the hash table.

field.label: Init limit half open
field.help: Limit new connections based on the current number of half open IKE_SAs.

field.label: Make Before Break
field.help: Initiate IKEv2 reauthentication with a make-before-break instead of a break-before-make scheme. Make-before-break uses overlapping IKE and CHILD SA during reauthentication by first recreating all new SAs before deleting the old ones. This behavior can be beneficial to avoid connectivity gaps during reauthentication, but requires support for overlapping SAs by the peer.

field.label: Install routes
field.help: Install routes into a separate routing table for established IPsec tunnels. If disabled a more efficient lookup for source and next-hop addresses is used.

field.label: Cisco Unity
field.help: Send Cisco Unity vendor ID payload (IKEv1 only).

field.label: Reqid base
field.help: Value of the first reqid to be automatically assigned to a CHILD_SA.

field.label: Tries
field.help: Number of retransmissions to send before giving up.

field.label: Timeout
field.help: Timeout in seconds.

field.label: Base
field.help: Base of exponential backoff

field.label: Jitter
field.help: Maximum jitter in percent to apply randomly to calculated retransmission timeout (0 to disable)

field.label: Limit
field.help: Upper limit in seconds for calculated retransmission timeout (0 to disable)

field.label: Ike Name
field.help: Prefix each log entry with the connection name and a unique numerical identifier for each IKE_SA.

field.label: Log Level
field.help: Add the log level of each message after the subsystem (e.g. [IKE2]).

field.label: Jobs queuing/processing and thread pool management
IKE_SA manager, handling synchronization for IKE_SA access
Subnet
field.help: The protected sub-networks that this edge-device protects (in CIDR notation). Usually ignored in deference to local_ts, though macOS clients will use this for routes

field.label: DNS
field.help: DNS server

field.label: NBNS
field.help: WINS server

field.label: Split-include
field.help: Comma-separated list of subnets to tunnel. The unity plugin provides a connection specific approach to assign this attribute.

field.label: Default search
field.help: Default search domain used when resolving host names via the assigned DNS servers

field.label: Split DNS name
field.help: If split tunneling is used clients might not install the assigned DNS servers globally. This space-separated list of domain names allows clients, such as macOS, to selectively query the assigned DNS servers. Seems Mac OS X uses only the first item in the list

field.label: Login banner
field.help: Message displayed on certain clients after login

field.label: Save password
field.help: Allow client to save Xauth password in local storage
